page.title: Draft:English settlement in the Bay of Honduras

revision.comment: Disable the categories on this page while it is still a draft, per [[WP:DRAFTNOCAT]]/[[WP:USERNOCAT]] (using [[User:DannyS712/Draft no cat|Draft no cat]] v1.8). The easiest way to do this is by converting them to links, by adding a colon: "[[Category:" → "[[:Category:"

Assembly}} |house1 = |type_house1 = |house2 = |type_house2 = |stat_year1 = 1638 |stat_area1 = 1 |stat_pop1 = 80 |stat_year2 = 1862 |stat_area2 = 22966 |stat_pop2 = 13870 |stat_year3 = |stat_area3 = |stat_pop3 = |stat_year4 = |stat_area4 = |stat_pop4 = |stat_year5 = |stat_area5 = |stat_pop5 = |today = [[Belize]] |footnote_a = |footnote_b = |footnote_h = |footnotes = }} The '''English settlement in the Bay of Honduras''', or '''Honduras''', was an unauthorised, illicit settlement of English [[buccaneers]], or [[Baymen]], in the [[Yucatan Peninsula]] from its founding in 1638 to its gaining colonial status in 1862. == Geography == === Physical === === Political === ==== ''de jure'' ==== The sites of [[Belize City|Belize]], [[Barcadares]], and [[St. George's Caye|St. George's]] were part of the district or ''municipio'' of [[Bacalar]], in [[Captaincy General of Yucatan|Spanish Yucatan]], in [[New Spain]], since 1544. They were transferred to the district or ''municipio'' of [[Cobán|Verapaz]], in [[Captaincy General of Guatemala|Spanish Guatemala]], in [[New Spain]], in 1658. ==== ''de facto'' ==== Bacalar (likely) never established ''reducción'' settlements at the sites of Belize, Barcadares, and St. George's. During 1610s–1630s, English and Dutch pirates, privateers, and buccaneers began using the district's waters as a safe haven. During 1638–1642, a widespread revolt from [[Tipu, Belize|Tipu]] resulted in the ''villa'''s loss of control over its district, and the relocation of the district's Mayan residents towards Tipu. == History == === Prelude === === Settlement === In 1638, a crew of shipwrecked English [[buccaneers]] settled [[Belize City|Belize]]. == Government == == Economy == == Demographics == == Society == === Religion === == Legacy == === Social === === Scholarly === == Notes == {{reflist|group=note}} == Citations == {{reflist}} == References == {{refbegin}} === Serials === === Theses === === Journals === === Print === {{refend}} {{British overseas territories}} {{Spanish Empire}} {{Pirates}} {{Authority control}} [[:Category:Piracy in the Caribbean]] [[:Category:History of Belize]] [[:Category:17th-century pirates]] [[:Category:18th-century pirates]] [[:Category:Caribbean pirates]] [[:Category:English pirates]]
